snippet: New York City’s public hospital system chose Epic Systems Corporation over Allscripts for a $303 million contract.
abstract: Allscripts, one of the country's largest providers of electronic medical records, files claim against New York City’s public hospital system; company lost its bid to replace the system's antiquated medical-records system to rival Epic Systems Corporation, and claims that when all ancillary costs are included, its system would be $700 million cheaper to build than the $1.4 billion total estimated by Epic.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s public hospital system chose Epic Systems Corporation over Allscripts for a $303 million contract.

headline.seo: Allscripts Protests Epic’s Bid for Electronic Medical Records
headline.main: Loser of Bid to Overhaul Hospital Logs Files a Claim
headline.print_headline: Loser of Bid To Overhaul Hospital Logs Files a Claim
